span.style: font-size:18; font-family:Comic Sans MS; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; color:#550000
font-size:14; font-family:微软雅黑; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; color:#000000

item.answer:
【考法 1】 vt. 禁止： to forbid in a usually formal or authoritative manner
【例】 Though not interdicted by law, such an action is morally wrong. 尽管这种行为不被法律所禁止，但是道德上来说是不对的
【近】 ban, forbid, prohibit, proscribe
【反】 authorize 授权；allow, permit, suffer 允许；approve, endorse, ratify, sanction 批准
【考法 2】 vt. 阻止： to stop, seize, or interrupt while in progress or on course
【例】 Federal agents are able to interdict only a small percentage of the narcotic shipments into the country.联邦调查员们只能阻止一小部分流入国内的毒品
【近】 bar, block, check, hinder, intercept, impede, obstruct
【反】 expedite 促进，加速
【派】 interdiction n. 禁止，封锁
Latin inter (prep., adv.) "among, between, betwixt, in the midst of,"
【另】 contradict 驳斥， dictate 口述，dictator 独裁者, 口授令他人笔录者，edict 法令，indict 控告
，maledict 诅咒，predict预言，valedict 告别，verdict定论
